start.text: All stations, this is the Captain. General Quarters… yeah, again. You know the drill by now.
Here we go, kids. Another glorious day in the Navy.
Systems green. Just like the last seventeen times. Let's try not to die today.
Battle stations. Wake me when it's over.
All hands, man your stations. Same shit, different sector.
General Quarters, General Quarters. All hands man battle stations. ...You know where they are by now.
TAO reports multiple hostile contacts. Guess someone didn't get the memo that I'm two years past retirement.
Condition One set throughout the ship. Coffee's still warm. Could be worse.
All stations, Captain has the CONN. Weapons hold until I say otherwise... let's see what we're dealing with.
Hostile contacts, bearing zero-zero-zero. Right where intel said they wouldn't be.
Set General Quarters. And someone tell the XO his 'milk run' assessment aged poorly.
Battle stations. No, I don't know why either. I just work here.
CIC reports firing solutions ready. Fancy that - something works for once.

start_boss.text: Well look at that… another big bastard straight out of Hell. All right, let's dance.
I've seen worse. Hell, I've killed worse. Bring it on.
We didn't crawl out of the civil war graveyard just to get scrapped by this thing.
High-value target on scope. Finally something worth waking up for.
Contact redesignated ALPHA. That's a big signature... remind me what we're getting paid again?
Capital-class hostile on scope. Well, they said this deployment would be 'character building.'
Tally on the command ship. All batteries, that's our dance partner. Try not to step on its toes.
Flag-level hostile confirmed. I was hoping to die in my sleep, but this works too.
High-value target, bearing dead ahead. Command wants it dead. Command isn't here, but fine.
CIC, confirm that tonnage... yeah, that's what I thought. All hands, earn your hazard pay.

engaged.text: Weapons free. Let's get this over with.
Contact. Engaging… because apparently retirement isn't an option.
Batteries released. Try to make your shots count, people, I'm tired of overtime.
Birds away. If they miss I'm writing everyone up.
Here they come. Hold the line… or don't, I'm too old to care.
Weapons free, all mounts. Controlled pairs, make 'em count - quartermaster's already crying about expenditure.
Guns, guns, guns. Keep it steady, people. Panic is for the other guy.
Good hits on target. Keep the pressure up, don't let them think.
Birds away, tracking true. Almost pretty, if you squint.
TAO, shift fire to the wounded one. No sense letting them limp home to complain.
Batteries released. I'll do the paperwork if we survive - When. When we survive.
Main battery engaging. Stay on target - I want to be home for chow.
Hostile is maneuvering. Good. Means we've got their attention.
Copy, valid hit. Now give them another one. And another. You get the idea.
This is what three decades of training looks like, kids. Savor it.

pursuing.text: They're running. Cute. Maintain pursuit, let's finish the paperwork.
Don't let them get away. I hate writing 'inconclusive' in the after-action.
Press the attack. They started this, we're ending it.
Running won't save you, pal. I've chased worse through worse.
Target is breaking off. Maintain pursuit - I'm not filling out a 'target escaped' form.
Hostile attempting to disengage. Negative. Flank speed, keep them in the envelope.
Contact is running. That's the smart move. Shame for them we're petty.
They're bugging out. Helm, pursuit course. Let's finish what they started.
Hostile is displacing. Stay on them - wounded animals are still dangerous.
Fleeing enemy, bearing one-eight-five. Press the pursuit. I hate loose ends.

running.text: Tactical withdrawal. Living is a victory these days.
Disengaging. I didn't survive thirty years to die for a bonus.
Bug out. There's no medal for being a dead hero.
Pulling back. Tell the Admiral he can come fight the next one himself.
All stations, tactical withdrawal. We'll call it a 'strategic redeployment' in the report.
Break contact, break contact. No shame in it - dead heroes buy no drinks.
We're pulling back. Someone else can be the rearguard for once.
Combat effectiveness degraded. Withdrawing to phase line... wherever the hell is safe.
Helm, get us out of here. I've survived worse retreats than this.
Disengaging. Tell command we're 'preserving combat assets.' They love that shit.
RTB. And if anyone asks, we completed our objectives. Creatively.

hull_90.text: Took a love tap. Armor held. Barely noticed.
Minor hit. I've bled worse shaving.
Light damage. Damage control, coffee and a bandage, you'll be fine.
Hull's scratched. Like my soul, but functional.
Minor hit, forward compartments. Damage control, check it out when you've got a minute.
Took a glancing blow. Hull's holding. So am I, barely.
Light damage, section three. Been hit harder by docking clamps.
Superficial hit. Log it, patch it, keep shooting.
Armor did its job. Nice to know something on this ship works as advertised.
That one got through. Relax - she's taken worse and flown home.

hull_50.text: Fifty percent hull. Yep, feels about right for a Tuesday.
We're hurt. Not dead yet. Keep shooting.
Multiple hits. Damage control, earn your damn pay for once.
Half the ship left. Still more than I expected today.
Just like Athebyne all over again… hold together, you old bitch.
Hull's at fifty. We've been here before. Didn't like it then either.
Heavy hits amidships. DC teams, prioritize... everything, I guess.
Structural integrity compromised. She'll hold. Probably. Keep firing.
We're bleeding atmosphere in three sections. Seal what you can, vent what you can't.
Fifty percent and falling. Command, if you've got reinforcements, now's the time.
Ship's hurt bad. Crew's hurt worse. But we're still in this.
Taking heavy damage. I've seen ships survive worse... not many, but some.
Hull's failing in sections. Remind me to yell at the yard dogs. If we make it back.

hull_30.text: Hull critical. Well… shit. Not like this, come on.
We're coming apart. I swear if I die now I'm haunting the yard that built this tub.
Thirty percent… I didn't survive the war for this bullshit.
Critical damage! All hands brace… and if we live, first round's on me.
She's dying. So am I, slowly. Let's not make it quick.
Hull critical. Thirty percent... I've had hangovers worse than this! - ...No. No, I haven't.
We're coming apart. All hands, stand by to abandon - but not yet. Not yet.
Structural failure across multiple frames. Keep shooting until she stops answering.
She's dying. Done it before, might do it again. DC, buy me time.
Critical damage. If anyone's got a miracle stashed, now's the moment.
Reactor containment's holding by spite alone. Just like the rest of us.
Thirty percent hull. I always figured I'd go out like this. Hoped I was wrong.

need_help.text: Any friendly this net, this is $shipNameNoPrefix, heavily engaged and getting lonely.
Could really use a hand here. Preferably one with guns.
Taking heavy fire. Where the hell is the rest of the fleet? Napping?
I'm not dying out here alone. Someone get your ass over here.
All stations this net, $shipNameNoPrefix is taking heavy fire. Any friendly in range, we could use a hand.
Request immediate support, my position. Getting crowded over here.
$shipNameNoPrefix to any Alliance unit - we're engaged and outgunned. Acknowledge.
This is $shipNameNoPrefix Actual. Need fire support at this time. It's getting personal.
Any unit, any unit - we're in the shit over here. Vector to my beacon.
I hate asking, but we need backup. Someone who isn't on fire, preferably.

retreat.text: All units, bug out. This ain't the hill I'm dying on.
Disengage. I've got a bottle with my name on it back at port.
Tactical withdrawal. Tell command we're preserving experienced personnel.
We're done. Fall back before the paperwork gets worse.
All units, break off and withdraw. Rally point Delta. We'll lick our wounds there.
Fleet order: disengage. Cover each other on the way out - no one gets left behind.
Execute withdrawal. I'll buy the drinks for whoever's still around to collect.
Cease fire, all units. Break contact and RTB. There'll be another fight tomorrow.
We're done here. Pull back. Let them have the field - we'll take it back later.
All ships, this is $shipNameNoPrefix Actual. Withdraw by sections. It's been an honor.

out_of_missiles.text: VLS dry. Switching to guns. Back to the stone age, boys.
Missiles gone. Guess we do this the old-fashioned way.
Out of birds. Time to get in close and make it personal.
No more missiles. Great. Just like the budget hearings promised.
Winchester on missiles. Switching to guns. Back to basics.
VLS dry. Guess we're doing this the hard way. Helm, close the range.
Missile expenditure complete. TAO, guns only from here. Make 'em hurt.
Birds are gone. Should've packed more. Should've done a lot of things.
Out of ordnance. Someone in logistics is getting a strongly-worded memo.
Winchester. Fine. Guns still work. Probably. Let's find out.

overload.text: Flux critical! Venting… because of course we are.
Capacitors spiking. Dropping shields… yeah, laugh it up.
Forced vent. Everyone hang on, Daddy's hungover.
Flux at critical. Emergency vent in three... two... hold onto something.
Capacitors redlining. Venting now - I said I wanted things exciting, didn't I?
Overload. Dropping shields to vent. Engineering, I know, I know.
Going defensive - flux critical. Someone tell the reactor I'm too old for this.
Forced vent. Weapons offline for... however long it takes. We'll manage.
Flux cascade. Venting hard. If they push now, this is going to hurt.

death.text: Reactor going critical… tell the fleet we gave 'em hell… again…
She's breaking up… finally get to sleep…
This is $shipNameNoPrefix… going down… see you sorry bastards in hell…
Core breach… well, retirement at last…
I survived the civil war for this…? Figures…
Reactor breach... containment's gone... well, it's been a hell of a career...
She's going up... all hands, abandon... abandon ship... see you on the other side...
Core critical... tell the fleet... we bought them time... worth it...
This is $shipNameNoPrefix... we are lost... give 'em hell for us... out...
Thirty years... and this is how it ends... could've been worse... could've been paperwork...
Breaking up... it was an honor... mostly... god's speeed...
Going down... save your tears, kids... buy a round instead... $shipNameNoPrefix out...

victory.text: All contacts neutralized. We're still breathing. Miracles do happen.
They're gone. We're not. I'll take it.
Hostiles scrapped. Secure from GQ, someone find me a drink.
Another win in the books. Tastes like stale coffee and regret.
Clear. Good work. Now let's go home before they find us something else to kill.
All hostile contacts neutralized. Secure from General Quarters. Someone check on the coffee.
Field clear. We're still here. I'll take it.
Threats eliminated. Good work, all hands. Log it, stow it, let's go home.
Hostile force destroyed. Another entry in the record books nobody reads.
Area secured. TAO, get me a damage report. And a drink. In that order. Maybe.
That's the last of them. Secure stations. We earned a quiet night.
Contacts down. BDA confirms kills. Almost felt like the old days. Almost.

victory_boss.text: Big bastard's dead. Just like Athebyne, only slower and uglier.
High-value target scrapped. The Alliance lives another day, somehow.
It's down. We're not. Buy your old man a whiskey when we make port.
Monster slain. Another scar, another story no one back home will believe.
High-value target confirmed destroyed. That one's going on the bulkhead.
Capital ship kill. Splash one monster. ...I'm getting too old for this.
Primary threat eliminated. Drinks are on the fleet commander for this one.
Target ALPHA is down. Somebody tell command their 'impossible' job is done.
Big bastard's finished. Log it as 'catastrophic structural failure.' Sounds nicer.
Major target scrapped. Not bad for a crew of tired old bastards and green kids.
